pr_title: Re-assign InputSplits on members for LocalFileSystem

timeline.message: re-assign input splits on members if all the input paths are of the local file system

timeline.bodyText: This is a change in the Hadoop connector behavior, right? Maybe we should default to true, which is current behavior.
timeline.author: frant-hartm
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -62,12 +62,30 @@ * * 
{@code
      *     Configuration conf = new Configuration();
-     *     conf.set(HadoopSources.COPY_ON_READ, "false");
+     *     conf.setBoolean(HadoopSources.COPY_ON_READ, false);
      *     BatchSource> source = HadoopSources.inputFormat(conf);
      * }
*/ public static final String COPY_ON_READ = "jet.source.copyonread"; + /** + * When reading files from local file system using Hadoop, each processor + * reads files from its own local file system. If the local file system + * is shared between members, e.g multiple members on a machine, you should + * configure this property as {@code true}. + *

+ * Here is how you can configure the source. Default value is {@code false}:

replies.bodyText: yes this is a behavior change but I'll argue that previous behaviour was wrong so we shouldn't try to keep it as default.
replies.author: gurbuzali

timeline.bodyText: AFAIK we don't recommend running multiple members on a single machine, so the javadoc should give a better example, e.g. NFS mounted filesystem or similar.
timeline.author: frant-hartm

timeline.bodyText: This still happens on the coordinator node, the reassign must be in get(int) method.
timeline.author: frant-hartm

timeline.bodyText: Maybe just use a regular for instead of stream().map(...) - mutating in map is a code smell.
timeline.author: frant-hartm

timeline.bodyText: Ha! It's correct here in the ReadHadoopOldApiP
timeline.author: frant-hartm

timeline.bodyText:
The shared FS flag is set to false, maybe we should always reassign and forbid non-local FS & shared=false combination.
Also we can avoid assigning the splits in meta supplier if we assign them here.
timeline.author: frant-hartm

replies.bodyText:
I thought SHARED_LOCAL_FS property as a way to pass sharedFileSystem parameter from file source builder to hadoop implementation. it is false by default on file source builder. if it is explicitly set to true we don't do the re-assign, if it is not set then we check the filesystem and if all the inputs are local we re-assign.
I don't have a strong opinion here, let's discuss it
replies.author: gurbuzali

timeline.author: frant-hartm

replies.bodyText: I don't think so but we can add that check too just to be on the safe side
